Title: Is every factorial divisible by its sum of digits?
Content: Denote by $\Sigma_d(t)$ the sum of digits in the decimal representation of the number $t$. Prove / disprove: $$\forall n\in \mathbb N:\ \ \Sigma_d (n!) | n!$$
AcceptedAnswer: It's not true.  The first counterexample is for $ n = 432 $.  The sum of the digits in $ 432! $ is 3897, which you can see using Wolfram Alpha .  But the prime factorisation of 3897  is $ 3^2 \times 433 $, so $ 432! $ cannot be divisible by its sum of digits. The list of counterexamples is sequence A066419 in the OEIS.
